conclusion: The graph shows v^2 on the y-axis and x on the x-axis.
Both cars start from the same position and move in the same direction.
For uniformly accelerated motion, the relationship is v^2 = u^2 + 2ax.
Since both cars start from rest, u = 0, so v^2 = 2ax.
The equation v^2 = 2ax is a linear equation of the form y = mx, where m is the slope.
The slope m is equal to 2a.
From the graph, the slope of the line for Car A is steeper than the slope of the line for Car B.
A steeper slope indicates a greater value of 2a.
Car A has a steeper slope compared to Car B.
Car A has the greater acceleration.
